results.title: Tabaluga. Volume 3
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Tabaluga GbmH
results.brief_description: A German-Australian co-production created by Peter Maffay, Gregor Rottschalk and Rolf Zuckowski, Tabaluga is the last surviving dragon on earth. Using a combination of fire and flight, both peaceful options, Tabaluga fights his nemesis the evil snowman Arktos, intent on ruining Tabaluga’s home of Greenland by covering it with snow and ice, thus making it inhospitable. Popular with adults and children alike, “Tabaluga” is in its third series and a feature film is in production. “The Wiser head does not give in” (story by Gregor Rottschalk): Arktos is firing snowballs at the volcano, covering it in a layer of white, rendering the volcano frozen and threatening to take over the rest of Greenland. Tabaluga is given an ultimatum, himself in exchange for the safety of the other occupants of Greenland. “Two birds with one stone” (story by Gregor Gottschalk, Heike Lage): A slumbering Tabaluga is carried by a group of soldier ants back to their Queen. She blames Tabaluga for the destruction of her Blue Army but soon comes to realise they have a common enemy in Arktos. “Moonstruck” (story by Gregor Rottschalk): Tabaluga vows to fly to the moon, even though no one else has successfully ever made it there. He seeks the assistance of Arktos and his powerful telescope to see it. Voices provided by Keith Scott, Robyn Moore, Jamie Oxenbould.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Shell trio
results.brief_description: A series of three commercials which established the “Go Well - Go Shell” theme for one year. The three commercials vary in mood and approach. Individual titles are “Theme”, “Rain” and “Coast road”.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Mobil circle of safety
results.creator_credit: Mobil Oil Australia and George Patterson Creative Group
results.brief_description: A series of television commercials made with the aim of promoting road safety and advertising the mechanical safety services available from the Mobil service stations. The nine commercials include: Swinging tyres, Traffic trauma, Eye, Cannonball, Queue, Go back, Cosmos, Belt up and Playground. Intellegent copy and strong images reinforce the message as well as the oil company’s logo.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Hushpower
results.brief_description: A set of eight 60-second commercials which provide a continuous “prestige” image for British Airways through the presence of “Captain Bristow” in each film. Shows variations on a single theme.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Holdens
results.brief_description: A series of ten commercials which represent the total television advertising campaign by GM-H over one year. Individual titles include: “Breakaway”, “Scene stealers”, “Big car/little car”, “Little old lady”, “Fishing village” and “Rain”.

results.title: T.V. commercials: four types
results.brief_description: A series of commercials using different approaches: hard sell, with emphasis on product and brand name; hard sell message with soft sell approach; soft sell, in which the emphasis is not solely on the product; and the testimonial technique for viewer identification. Products featured: Tarax, ANZ Christmas Club, ANZ Travel, Export Action, ANZ Cheque Account, Sidchrome.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Dulux
results.creator_credit: George Patterson Creative Group and Senior Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents two 60-second commercials with an identical tag line: “The one paint good enough”. Illustrates the paint company’s product in old and new settings: Como House in Melbourne and a new jet airliner for Trans Australia Airlines.

results.title: T.E. Lawrence
results.creator_credit: Philip Donnellan, Malcolm Brown and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Portrait of “Lawrence of Arabia” a profoundly controversial figure with a reputation swinging between hero worship on the one hand and contempt on the other. Tells the story of his life and death (1935) with the richest and most authentic material available in the hope that a real and credible Lawrence will emerge. Original photographs, drawings of Eric Kennington, and mementos from friends are used. Written and narrated by David Lytton, voice of T.E. Lawrence by Cyril Cusack.

results.title: T Pyxidis
results.creator_credit: Melanie Steptoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Melanie Steptoe recounts the story of T Pyxidis, a star. Sensing the wonders of the universe, T Pyxidis takes a bold step and initiates a journey to the Earth.
